text: English monks recorded "no man then alive could remember so severe a winter as this was." Their analog weather blog entry recorded the beginning of the Little Ice Age.
Friedrich Schmiedl launched the first rocket mail (V-7, Experimental Rocket 7) with 102 pieces of mail between Schockl and St. Radegund, Austria.
Detective Leonarde Keeler, co-inventor of the Keeler polygraph, tried out the lie detector on two suspected criminals in Portage, Wisconsin. Both suspects were convicted of assault.
